enWisdom: Idle talk takes one closer to [unpleasant] changes [in circumstances]
Keep away from idle talk, for the least of its damage is blame

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْهَذَرَ فَمَنْ كَثُرَ كَلَامُهُ كَثُرَتْ آثَامُهُ
enWisdom: Beware of idle talk, for the one whose talk increases, his sins [also] increase

Wisdom: قُبْحُ الْحَصَرِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ جُرْحِ [حَرَجِ‏] الْهَذَرِ
enWisdom: The ugliness of dyslogia is better than the harm of talking nonsense

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْهَذَرِ تَمَلُّ الْجَلِيسَ وَتُهِينُ الرَّئِيسَ
إِيَّاكَ وَمُسْتَهْجَنَ الْكَلَامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُوغِرُ الْقَلْبَ [الْقُلُوبَ‏]
enWisdom: Beware of offensive speech for indeed it fills the hearts with spite [and hatred]

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمَا يُسْتَهْجَنُ مِنَ الْكَلَامِ فَإِنَّهُ يَحْبِسُ عَلَيْكَ اللِّئَامَ وَيُنَفِّرُ عَنْكَ الْكِرَامَ
enWisdom: Beware of speech which is offensive, for indeed it confines you to [the company of] vile people and repels the honourable ones from you

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يَتَكَلَّمُ فِيمَا إِنْ حَكَى عَنْهُ ضَرَّهُ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَحْكِ عَنْهُ لَمْ يَنْفَعْهُ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who speaks about that which, if it is related from him, will harm him and if it is not related from him, will not benefit him

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يَتَكَلَّمُ بِمَا لَا يَنْفَعُهُ فِي دُنْيَاهُ وَلَا يُكْتَبُ لَهُ أَجْرُهُ فِي أُخْرَاهُ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who speaks about that which neither benefits him in this world nor for which reward is written for him in the Hereafter
